intro: Sicklera tetrandra, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sickler, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in coastal regions and is often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
